definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
lit. the barefooted people are not afraid of those who wear shoes (idiom)/fig. the poor, who have nothing to lose, do not fear those in power
pinyin: guang1 jiao3 de5 bu4 pa4 chuan1 xie2 de5

sentences.english: They can also be worse when walking barefoot or wearing flat shoes.
sentences.chinese: 光脚或者穿平底鞋走路也可能如此。

sentences.english: It is being considered as a sign of poverty.
sentences.chinese: 光脚成为了贫困的象征。

sentences.english: Pants should almost touch the ground without your shoes on.
sentences.chinese: 裤子应该能在光脚时触地。

sentences.english: Then at the thought of Ashley barefooted, Scarlett could have cried.
sentences.chinese: 想到艾希礼在光脚走路，于是思嘉也快哭了。

sentences.english: And thethird3rd group had changed to shoeless running.
sentences.chinese: 第三组则是从穿鞋变到光脚跑。

sentences.english: Bare feet, spikes and footwear with screw-in studs are not permitted.
sentences.chinese: 光脚，长钉鞋和有螺旋铁钉的球鞋是不允许的。

sentences.english: Five feet nine inches in hellos socks.
sentences.chinese: 光脚身高五英尺九英寸。

sentences.english: Enjoying the view of barefooted girls.
Her bare feet slapped against the cold marble floor.
sentences.chinese: 她的光脚在冰冷的大理石地板上啪啪作响。

sentences.english: But, in fact, a recent study shows running without shoes is actually healthier.
sentences.chinese: 但事实上，最近的一项显示，光脚跑步实际更健康。

sentences.english: I love the fun of splashing barefoot in the puddles.
sentences.chinese: 我爱那种光脚踩在积水中的乐趣。

sentences.english: It has a positive effect on the overall posture of the body.
sentences.chinese: 光脚走路对我们整个身体姿态都有积极的作用。

sentences.english: On her bare feet she was wearing satin slippers, and she was finishing her nails.
sentences.chinese: 她光脚吸着缎子拖鞋，还在擦着指甲。

sentences.english: Barefoot runners land on the balls of their feet.
sentences.chinese: 而光脚跑步者是前脚掌着地。

definition: to step on/to tread/to stamp/to press a pedal/to pedal (a bike)/(online) to downvote
flip-flops/abbr. for 人字拖鞋[ren2 zi4 tuo1 xie2]
flip-flops/flip-flop sandals/thongs/see also 人字拖[ren2 zi4 tuo1]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
to feet the feet perfectly/to follow closely/hard on sb's heels
